Title: Irony
References: ŠTULAJTEROVÁ, A., JESENSKÁ, P.: English Stylistics. 1. vyd. Banská Bystrica : Univerzita Mateja Bela, 2013. 114 s.
Content:
Irony is a figure of speech that implies the opposite of what is actually said.

The word containing the irony is strongly marked by intonation. Irony is generally used to express a negative meaning. In simple words, it is the difference between the appearance and the reality.

examples:

  • " What a splendid day for a hike" she said after she looked outside the window and it was raining.
  • Yes, the test was very easy. I had zero points.
